title: Calories in a Serving of Noodles
meta_description: Discover calories in a noodles, including macros like carbs and protein, per 100g basis, and simple tweaks for variations.
h1: Calories in a Serving of Noodles
assumptions: Plain cooked wheat noodles (e.g., spaghetti), boiled without added salt, oil, or sauce; 1 serving = 100 g drained.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by noodle type (wheat, rice, etc.), brand, cooking method, and portion size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One serving (100 g) of plain cooked noodles has ~158 kcal and ~31 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil per serving
Whole wheat noodles instead of white

faqs.q: How many calories in a noodles serving?
faqs.a: About 158 kcal for 100 g plain cooked noodles.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a noodles?
faqs.a: Roughly 31 g carbs per 100 g serving, mostly from starch.
Yes, around 5.8 g protein per 100 g.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in a noodles?
faqs.a: Boiled plain is lowest; frying or adding oil increases calories significantly.

faqs.q: Are there calories in a noodles without sauce?
faqs.a: Yes, ~158 kcal per 100 g from the pasta itself; sauces add more.
